result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J. Hake was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Marathon County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution to F.B. in 2014CF277 within first month of today's date.
Maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours community service per week.
No contact with M.B. unless agent approves.

Assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the agent. 
Letter of apology to M.B. 
Court finds defendant is not entitled to any days jail credit if revoked. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

supervisions.notes: Jail with huber for employment/counseling/school/military commitment if defendant qualifies under jail criteria or electronic monitoring if eligible.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael J. Hake

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 3:30 pm 
INCLUDES 14CF277, 14CF970, 17CF1433, 18CF495, and 18CF619. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Deft appears in person with Atty Peter Prusinski. 

SENTENCING IN 14CF277 AND 14CF970 ONLY. 
VRCW. 
Argument. Deft makes statement. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT ORDERS: SWH for 5 yrs probation - CONDITIONS: AODA and follow through with recommendations; anger management and/or SAFE program at the discretion of the agent; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety from alcohol; no going upon the premises of any Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, Beer Tents or any other premises that has as its primary source of business the sale of alcohol; restitution of $84 to F.B. to be paid within first 6 months of probationary period; good faith effort at fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; 6 months MCJ with huber for work/treatment to begin at the agent's discretion; DNA sample/surcharge; CC. 
COURT finds the deft entitled to NO days jail credit. 
State to draft restitution order. 

Adj: 4:14 pm

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 3:33 pm 
INCLUDES 14CF277, 14CF568, AND 14CF970. 
State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Peter Prusinski. 
States notes parties are only addressing sentencing after revocation in 14CF568 and other files are tracking. 
COURT notes motion to revoke DEOJ in 14CF277 and will hold that motion in abeyance. 

SENTENCING AFTER REVOCATION IN 14CF568. 
State notes joint agreement. Deft makes statement. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT ORDERS: On Ct. 1 (Misd. BJ)>>9 months MCJ with huber for employment/counseling/school/military commitment if deft qualifies under jail criteria or electronic monitoring if eligible and payment of court costs with 60 days to pay or payment plan. 
COURT finds the deft is entitled to 48 days jail credit. 

MODIFICATION OF BOND IN 14CF970. 
State notes parties are stipulating to modification of bond in this file. 
COURT approves stipulation of bond - bond is modified to $5000 signature bond with same conditions as previously ordered.

Case Called: 10:31 am 
INCLUDES 14CF277 AND 14CF568. 
State appears by DDA Theresa Wetzsteon for Lisa Gramer; Def appears in person with Atty Peter Prusinski.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to:
In 14CF568: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>AMEND to Misd. BJ pursuant to 946.49(1)(a). 
                    : Ct. 2 (Battery)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 3 (DC)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 14CF277: Ct. 1 (Forgery)>>GUILTY. 
In 14CF568: Amended Ct. 1 (Misd. BJ)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, def guilty of amended Ct. 1 in 14CF568, and defers entry of judgment on Ct. 1 in 14CF277. Atty Prusinski makes statement. Def makes statement.  

COURT ORDERS: In 14CF277: Ct. 1 (Forgery)>>DEOJ for 2 years with conditions as outlined in written agreement. 
                           : In 14CF568: Ct. 1 (Misd. BJ)>>SWH for 1 year probation - CONDITONS: pay $84 restitution to F.B. in 14CF277 within first month of today's date; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the agent; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours community service per week; letter of apology to M.B; no contact with M.B. unless agent approves; payment of court costs. 
COURT finds def is entitled to NO days jail credit if revoked in 14CF568. 
Review of DEOJ in 14CF277 set for August 26, 2016 at 10:45 am with Br. 3 Judge.
